de.polygonal.ds.PriorityQueue<T>

type
class
implements
Queue<T>

A priority queue is heap data structure with a simplified API for managing prioritized data.

Adds additional methods for removing and re-prioritizing elements.

Constructor

new(?inverse : Bool, ?reservedSize : Int, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
inverse if true, the lower the number, the higher the priority. By default a higher number means a higher priority.
reservedSize the initial capacity of the internal container. See reserve().
maxSize the maximum allowed size of the priority queue.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this priority queue.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

Instance Methods

back() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError priority queue is empty (debug only).
Returns the rear element.
This is the element with the lowest priority.

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all elements.

clone(assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only). If assign is true, only the copied version should be used from now on.
Duplicates this priority queue. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this priority queue contains the element x.

inline dequeue() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError priority queue is empty (debug only).
Dequeues the front element.

inline enqueue(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is null or x already exists (debug only).
Enqueues the element x.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this priority queue is empty.

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new PriorityQueueIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this priority queue.
The values are visited in an unsorted order.

pack() : Void

For performance reasons the priority queue does nothing to ensure that empty locations contain null.
pack() therefore nullifies all obsolete references and shrinks the container to the actual size allowing the garbage collector to reclaim used memory.

inline peek() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError priority queue is empty (debug only).
Returns the front element.
This is the element with the highest priority.

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if x was removed.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError x is invalid or does not exist (debug only).
Removes the element x.

reprioritize(x : T, priority : Int) : Void

parameters
x the element to re-prioritize.
priority the new priority.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError priority queue is empty or x does not exist (debug only).
Reprioritizes the element x.

reserve(x : Int) : Void

Preallocates internal space for storing x elements.
This is useful if the expected size is known in advance - many platforms can optimize memory usage if an exact size is specified.

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements.

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an unordered array containing all elements in this priority queue.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all elements in this priority queue.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Requires that all elements implement Cloneable.
Example:

	  class Foo implements de.polygonal.ds.Prioritizable
	  {
	      public var priority:Int;
	      public var position:Int;

	      public function new(priority:Int) {
	        this.priority = priority;
	      }

	      public function toString():String {
	        return Std.string(priority);
	      }
	  }

	  class Main
	  {
	      static function main() {
	          var pq = new de.polygonal.ds.PriorityQueue<Foo>(4);
	          pq.enqueue(new Foo(5));
	          pq.enqueue(new Foo(3));
	          pq.enqueue(new Foo(0));
	          trace(pq);
	      }
	  }
	  {PriorityQueue, size: 3}
	  |< front
	     0 -> 5
	     1 -> 3
	     2 -> 0
	  >|
